alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 24 at 7:11PM MST until July 24 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... East central Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 711 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Paloma to 8 miles northeast of Sentinel to 16 miles northwest of Gila Bend Auxiliary Field to near Gila Bend, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 73 and 124. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 1 and 6. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 1 and 6, and between mile markers 119 and 146. Locations impacted include... Buckeye, Gila Bend, Painted Rock Dam, Sentinel, Paloma, Gila Bend Auxiliary Field, Bosque, Cotton Center, Sundad and Hyder. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
